item.title: Commandments of a Mobile Web
item.description: Over the past few years, there’s been certain paradigm shifts in web development. When you think of milestones that really changed how development on the web was done, the two biggest were Ajax and HTML5. Development was identifiably different before and after such technological advancements. There were some who initially doubted the technologies, but I’m sure such doubters eventually saw the light. After spending time working on applications for Mozilla’s upcoming mobile operating system, Firefox OS, and talking with my fellow employees, I feel that the mobile web is another one of those shifts in how we approach web development that looking back will be an identifiable point in time where we can say that we did things differently before and after.
